Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of opinion and expression as outlined in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
There is a risk of the bill being used to restrict public debate and censor unpopular opinions.
The bill lacks transparency and accountability, giving too much power to government bureaucrats and big tech.
Definitions of misinformation, disinformation, and harm are too vague, risking misuse.
The penalties for digital platforms are excessive and restrict free speech.
The bill could lead to government overreach and authoritarian control.
Notable Quotes: "I believe this bill will impose some of the most draconian controls of free speech in the Western world."
"The framework of this Bill is too vague in its definition of what is false, misleading, or deceptive."
"This is a very disappointing and underprepared Bill. I cannot see any good in the Bill, only harm from a Government narrative which clearly portrays a doctrine of 'My way or the Highway'."
